document.docAuthor: Huang, Guiqiang, Liu, Zhiping & Chen, Li
document.masterDocTitle: A revision of the genus Nyctimenius Gressitt, 1951 (Coleoptera: Cerambycidae: Lamiinae), with description of a new species

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: A revision of the genus Nyctimenius Gressitt, 1951 (Coleoptera: Cerambycidae: Lamiinae), with description of a new species

paragraph.treatmentCitationGroup:
Nyctimene ochraceovittata
Aurivillius, 1922 b
: 423
( type locality: “ Philippinen : Mindanao, Basilan, Tayabas and Bukidnon; Borneo: Sandakan.”), 1923 : 609 .

Nyctimene ochraceo-vittata
var. intermedia
Aurivillius, 1924
: 468
( type locality: “Leyte; Dinagat; Mindanao; Siargao.”).

Nyctimene ochraceo-vittata
var. extrema
Aurivillius, 1924
: 468
( type locality: “Mindoro; Siargao; Mindanao.”).

Nyctimenius ochraceovittata
m. griseolineata
Breuning, 1970
: 80
( type locality: “Bornéo”).

subSubSection.paragraph:
Variation. The intraspecific variation occurs in the colour of antennomeres VIII and X and elytral vittae. Antennomeres IX–X white in
N. ochraceovittata
(Aurivillius, 1992 b), segment X somewhat widely black at apex and sometimes narrowly white at base in
N. ochraceo-vittata
var. intermedia
, IX white and segment X entirely black in
N. ochraceo-vittata
var. extrema (
Aurivillius, 1924
)
, segment X black and apical half of segment VIII pale yellow as segment IX in
N. ochraceovittata
m. griseolineata (
Breuning, 1970
). Elytron covered with one yellow and three grayish white longitudinal vittae in first three (
Figs 23
–42), and elytron only with gray longitudinal vittae in
N. ochraceovittata
m. griseolineata (
Breuning, 1970
).

Comments. The specimen “NHRS-JLKB000021646” deposited in NHRS has no identification label. Dr. Johannes Bergsten ( NHRS ) told the senior author that the specimen (NHRS-JLKB000021646) belongs to
Nyctimenius ochraceovittata
m. extrema .

caption.paragraph:

Nyctimenius ochraceovittatus
syntype. 23. & 24. dorsal view; 25. ventral view; 26. lateral view; 27. labels.

Distribution. Philippines (Basilan, Dinagat, Leyte, Luzon, Mindanao, Mindoro, Negros Oriental, Panay, Siargao); Malaysia (Borneo).
